questions.question: What enables eye tracking?
questions.explanation: Eye tracker: monitors eye position, gaze. Uses: accessibility, VR, attention tracking. Accuracy: degree precision. Speed: milliseconds. Technology: infrared, video-based. Applications: gaming, research, medical.

questions.question: What provides motion sensing?
questions.explanation: IMU: measures motion, orientation. Sensors: accelerometer, gyroscope, magnetometer. Uses: motion gaming, robotics, drones. Accuracy: depends on quality. Calibration: necessary periodically. Importance: increasing in mobile devices.

questions.question: What enables gesture recognition?
questions.explanation: Gesture sensor: recognizes hand/body movements. Technologies: depth camera, radar, ultrasonic. Uses: VR, AR, touch-free interfaces. Accuracy: position, orientation tracking. Applications: gaming, navigation, control.

questions.question: What captures biometric data?
questions.explanation: Biometric scanner: captures unique physical traits. Types: fingerprint, iris, facial, voice. Uses: authentication, security. Accuracy: false positive/negative rates. Speed: instant identification. Privacy: data security critical.

questions.question: What provides environmental sensing?
questions.explanation: Environmental sensor: measures physical parameters. Examples: temperature, humidity, light, CO2. Uses: smart homes, IoT, environmental monitoring. Accuracy: depends on sensor type. Connectivity: WiFi, Bluetooth, wired.

questions.question: What outputs tactile sensations?
questions.explanation: Haptic suit: provides full-body tactile feedback. Uses: VR immersion, training simulations. Coverage: multiple actuators for sensations. Latency: must be low for realism. Cost: expensive currently. Future: VR/metaverse adoption pending.

questions.question: What enables augmented reality?
questions.explanation: AR display: overlays digital content. Types: glasses, headsets, smartphone screens. Technology: display optics, tracking sensors. Uses: gaming, navigation, industrial training. Challenges: weight, battery, field-of-view.

questions.question: What manages I/O bandwidth?
questions.explanation: I/O controller: manages device communication. Standards: USB, PCIe, SATA. Bandwidth: determines throughput. DMA: transfers without CPU. Multiplexing: handle multiple devices. Performance: critical system component.

questions.question: What converts color spaces?
questions.explanation: Color converter: transforms between color spaces. Examples: RGB to CMYK, YCbCr to RGB. Purpose: display optimization, printing. Accuracy: affects output quality. Implementation: hardware or software. Applications: image processing, displays.

questions.question: What integrates multiple sensors?
questions.explanation: Sensor fusion: combines data from multiple sensors. Purpose: improve accuracy, robustness. Algorithms: Kalman filter typical. Uses: robotics, autonomous vehicles, AR. Challenges: sensor calibration, latency. Importance: advanced systems critical.
